description: fast and with almost no resource usage, 10/10

The minute I opened the app, I found some serious bugs. 
- The position slider doesn't work propertly. Changing the position plays the next song.
- I can't seem to sign in. 
- It doesn't show currently playing music in the "media player" applet in KDE Plasma.
- No global menu support.

great yt music app, allthough id love it if there were settings and would defo recomend more if it had mpris dbus, since i was hoping to use this on my steamdeck with decky loader and the music plugin

When you start the app you pretty much get dropped into an empty screen. You can search for music and play it but that's about it, no option to login to your account. Also scrolling seem to be buggy with the "player" part of the window being partially hidden by the search results
summary: Doesn't seem to include a login option

description: It quickly finds the music and plays it straight away. For the desktop, the design needs to be reworked. Hamburger menu, customizable toolbar, in-page playlist, ...

The app works fine. I'm definately going to use it very frequently from now on. It needs some polish and features though but it's a good app for how new it is. Here's some things i'd like to see in the future.

Basic features:
* Volume slider
* Reorganisable Queues
* Use the side buttons of the mouse to go back (My muscle memory hates having to manually click the back button every time.
* Rewind back and forward (I don't know if this is just a bug but whenever I try rewind back or forward audio, the progress bar just pulls itself back to where it was at previously and plays from there)

Helpful features:
* Playlists
* Ability to subscribe to channels through the client

Polish:
* Be able to scroll with the scroll wheel when hovered over the scroll bar.
* Immediately stop whatever is being played when you click play on a different track. Often if you click on a different track just a few seconds or so before the song ends, the next song will begin in the queue even though you chose a new track, and than it will correct itself and play the song you chose a few seconds after, so immediately stopping the track to start the new one should solve the issue.

There's some more polish I was going to suggest but I forgot what it was.

Thanks KDE Devs for the great app.
summary: A great & simple YT music app that needs some polish and more features

description: Sadly it doesnt work on my OnePlus6T. It displays an exception with "params" not found in it, when trying to open a song.
AudioTube looks good but it's useless to me if i can't login to use and edit my playlists, which i find it worth two stars.

Really wanted to like it but the quality is below par with just going to YouTube. It's functional insofar it finds and plays music, but that's about it.

- Moving position slider doesn't change playback position.
- No loop button.
- Couldn't find an album that I know for sure exists.
- Starting/switching between tracks takes several seconds.
- Sound quality feels subjectively worse than on the website (couldn't really test due to point 1).
simple and works well. sounds good too. i like it.
It didn't open, when I tried to open it gave me a crash message. I'm using Fedora 38, Gnome 44.
It laks some features like importing and exporting playlists but it's actually a really good app
The best YT MUSIC CLIENT for Linux, wish there was a GTK4 equivalent for GNOME
Great app! Would be even better if I could actually sign into my Youtube account. I have YT premium.
It is Working Perfectly and Does What it Says.
It doest work at all.
Thanks for the work, but I can't even try using it. It is crashing right after startup. I found a ticket about it here: https://invent.kde.org/multimedia/audiotube/-/issues/24
The design is bad, and doesn't even look like a KDE app
You cant sign in with your own account. so its kinda useless
Supports lyrics, album art, etc. very cool!
No way to login in your account. Doesn't work for me in general.

The application seems to be missing a few things. there doesn't seem to be a way to add albums to your library at all? also the gaps between tracks are also massive which is a bit annoying for me (which also ruins transitions between tracks a bit)
I can search and get reults. The interface works well. But a youtube app is useless if you cannot play any video from it.
crashes for no reason when going through the UI and takes too long to open, kinda reminds me of VImusic on android, which works smoothly, can't wait for this one to be worked on
all of a sudden this program stopped working ...i m not sure why no idea as soon as i open this program it does not open just the system icon show up under my mouse pointer and then disappear

It is a fairly good looking app, with most features working well enough. However, stuff like offline playback and lyrics are still missing

description: I imported a playlist and it was auto scrambled with no other options, also the ui feels a little slow because it appears to download the music before playing which seems like a good design, but why have the playlist auto scrambled when importing

Es una aplicación que está bien diseñada, estéticamente no está mal y es funciona. Una pena que no se adapte al modo oscuro del sistema.
Se crashea, no abre ni instalando la versión paquete Nobara ni en Flatpak.

La integración del paquete Flatpak con el escritorio Plasma no es buena, no se muestran los controles multimedia en el centro de notificaciones. El botón de rebobinar sólo sirve para volver a la canción anterior y no para reiniciar la canción.

description:
Une belle appli qui fonctionne comme on l'espère et qui permets d'écouter sa musique tranquillement.

La recherche pourrait avoir besoin d'amélioration, notamment sur la recherche d'album ou d'artiste qui ne sort pas en premier, voir pas du tout, certains résultats malgrés une recherche bien tapée.
